prompt:
Nurse: Alright, Mr. Koroleva. I'd like to move onto the instructions for the clear liquid diet and NuLYTELY laxative solution. This is often the hardest part of the prep. How are you feeling about it?

Patient: Fine. Please continue.

Nurse: Thank you, Mr. Koroleva. I understand that this part can be a bit challenging. Most people say the procedure itself is no problem at all but the bowel prep can be a little bit tough. But we're here to support you every step of the way. Do you have any questions or concerns about this part of the preparation?

Patient: No.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. Koroleva. You don't have to do anything just yet. But you'll need to start your bowel prep 24 hours before your procedure by drinking only clear liquids which involves no solid foods and drinking either clear or light colored beverages without any red or purple dye. Can I share some examples of what clear liquids are and you can tell me what questions you have about the diet?

Patient: I guess.

Nurse: Thank you, Mr. Koroleva. Examples of clear liquids include water, green tea, clear broth, light colored sports drinks, and jello or other gelatin without fruit or red color. Do you have any questions about these examples or the clear liquid diet in general?

Patient: No.

responses.gpt4: Okay, Mr. Koroleva. Is there anything else about the diet changes that you're unsure of? We're here to guide and support you.

Would you like some tips on making the bowel prep easier?
